text: The 2018–19 Ekstraklasa was the 63rd season of the Ekstraklasa, Polish's top- tier handball league. A total of fourteen teams contested this season's league, which began on 31 August 2018 and concluded in May 2019. PGE Vive Kielce were the defending champions. ==Format== During the licensing process, work was underway to change the formula of the competition. Finally, the division into two groups was dropped and after the main round the teams will be divided into two groups: the first eight will create the quarter-final pairs, while the remaining six teams will play the match-revenge round for the Ekstraklasa. ==Teams== The following 14 clubs compete in the Ekstraklasa during the 2018–19 season. {| class="wikitable sortable" |- !Team ! width=100 | City ! width=230 | Arena ! width=60 | Capacity |- bgcolor=ffffe0 |Arka Gdynia |Gdynia |Gdynia Sports Arena | align="center" |5,500 |- bgcolor=ffffe0 |Energa MKS Kalisz |Kalisz |Arena Kalisz | align="center" |3,164 |- bgcolor=ffffe0 |Gwardia Opole |Opole |Stegu Arena | align="center" |3,378 |- bgcolor=ffffe0 |KS Azoty-Puławy |Puławy |Globus Hall | align="center" |4,119 |- bgcolor=ffffe0 |MMTS Kwidzyn |Kwidzyn |KWS KCSiR | align="center" |1,504 |- bgcolor=ffffe0 |NMC Górnik Zabrze |Zabrze |HWS Pogoń | align="center" |1,777 |- bgcolor=ffffe0 |PGE Vive Kielce |Kielce |Hala Legionów | align="center" |4,200 |- bgcolor=ffffe0 |Piotrkowianin Piotrków Trybunalski |Piotrków T. |Hala Relax | align="center" |1,800 |- bgcolor=ffffe0 |Pogoń Szczecin |Szczecin |Azoty Arena | align="center" |5,403 |- bgcolor=ffffe0 |SPR Chrobry Głogów |Głogów |HWS im. A loss after regulation time also add a bonus point. ===Standings=== ===Results=== ==Relegation round== A victory over a team in full-time added three points and after regulation time added two. A loss after regulation time also add a bonus point. ===Standings=== ===Results=== ===Play-offs=== |} SPR Stal Mielec won 64–53 aggregate and stays in the Superliga. ==Play-offs== ==Awards== ===Monthly awards=== {| class="wikitable" |- !rowspan="2"|Month !colspan="3"|Player of the Month |- !Player !Position !Club |- |September | Alex Dujshebaev |RB |PGE Vive Kielce |- |October | Mateusz Kornecki |GK |NMC Górnik Zabrze |- |November | Ignacy Bąk |RB |NMC Górnik Zabrze |- |December | Mateusz Kornecki |GK |NMC Górnik Zabrze |- |February | Iso Sluijters |RB |NMC Górnik Zabrze |- |March | Iso Sluijters |RB |NMC Górnik Zabrze |} ==References== ==External links== Poland Category:Handball competitions in Poland Category:2018 in Polish sport Category:2019 in Polish sport
